data.title: Hatchmere party for Hollywood couple Courteney Cox and Johnny McDaid
data.meta_description: HOLLYWOOD superstar Courteney Cox and her Snow Patrol boyfriend Johnny McDaid danced the night away in Hatchmere last weekend at a star studded…
data.text:
The celebrity couple were guests at a private party at The Carriers Inn overlooking Hatchmere Lake on Saturday night after attending an exclusive event at Delamere Events in Oakmere.

And the Friends actress was more than happy to pose for photographs with regulars at the award-winning pub and beer garden.

Courteney has been in a relationship with Johnny, the guitar and piano player from Snow Patrol, since 2013 and the couple were top of the guest list for a tipi party close to Delamere Forest.

Delamere Events is a popular wedding venue exclusive use of its stunning lakeside event space at Cherry Orchard Farm on Abbey Lane, which is made of four overlapping indigenous American-style tipi tents.

READ MORE: Courteney Cox and Johnny McDaid attend Delamere tipi party

The party was organised by Johnny’s sister and her husband, who live locally, and the celebrations continued at an after party held at the award-winning Carriers Inn.

Owner Leigh Capon said: “Courteney was at The Carriers Inn as a guest, as her boyfriend Johnny McDaid’s sister and her husband were celebrating their 20th wedding anniversary.

“The main event was held at Delamere Events and then we held the private after party which went late into the night.

“Courteney spoke to all the regulars and was happy to have pictures and selfies with everyone.

“She loved the evening!

“Johnny had a gig with the band in Sheffield on Sunday and the couple flew back to California on Monday.

“They will be visiting us again at The Carriers Inn, when they’re next over seeing family.”

READ MORE: Fancy a drink in the sun in this triple award-winning beer garden?

Celebrations will be continuing at The Carriers Inn throughout the summer.

Do you want to win tickets to the Summer of Sound music festival at the beginning of August?

To celebrate winning a hat-trick of Best Beer Garden awards for Mid Cheshire, The Carriers Inn in Hatchmere is giving away 25 pairs of tickets to their remaining Summer of Sound concert, held in the award-winning outdoor space.

An Elton John tribute act will be entertaining audiences on Friday, August 9, and you could be there.

Owner Leigh Capon said: “We wanted to celebrate winning our third award with readers of the Northwich and Winsford Guardian.

“Earlier this month, we gave away tickets to see our Madonna tribute artist Tasha Leaper, who is one of the UK’s premier tribute acts.

“We saw her at the Isle of Wight Festival in 2023 and booked her as soon as we got back.

“Our Elton John tribute act is appearing with his full band, The Elton John Experience, and has appeared on Britain’s Got Talent.

“We will have festival food available, outdoor bars serving a full range of drinks and cocktails.”

To be in with a chance of winning a pair of tickets to the remaining Summer of Sound event, featuring the Elton John tribute act, click on the link below and share your details.

Closing date: Wednesday, August 7.
